oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spring Hill United Methodist Church: view from the south
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eatherly, Brad, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of a historic brick church viewed from the south. The church has a stone foundation with a gabled roof and a rear addition that features a cross gable and another small gabled section. A large steeple topped with a cross dominates the church. Three stained glass windows are visible on the original portion of the building, along with a small brick chimney. The rear addition features two eight-over-eight sash windows, two white doors, and two six-over-six sash windows. The second floor has three eight-over-eight sash windows and the attic has a single six-over-six sash window.
The Spring Hill United Methodist Church has existed as a congregation perhaps since 1816. The current building was constructed in 1886.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Church buildings -- Tennessee
Methodist churches
